examples: Teachers should read more poetry to children.
Teachers are up in arms about new school tests.
Better ask teacher about.
The teacher placed the books on the desk.
The teacher called out our names one by one for attendance.
words.defineEn: someone who teaches things to people, particularly in a school
words.defineVi: một người dạy mọi thứ cho mọi người, đặc biệt là trong một trường học

examples: The nurse takes my blood pressure.
The nurses had to spoon-feed my mother after her stroke.
I thanked the nurse for her compassionate care during my stay in the hospital.
The nurse kindly explained the procedure to me and helped me feel at ease.
Nurses play an important role in providing healthcare and assisting doctors in treating patients.
words.defineEn: someone who has been trained to care for injured or sick people, particularly in a hospital
words.defineVi: một người đã được đào tạo để chăm sóc người bị thương hoặc bị bệnh, đặc biệt là trong bệnh viện

examples: The journalist published a wrong statement in the article.
Journalists on the spot reported no progress.
Journalists have to learn the tricks of the trade quickly if they want to get the good stories.
As a journalist, I know that a carpenter is known by his chips.
The journalist's investigation uncovered a network of the gnomes of Zurich who were involved in manipulating global currency markets for their own benefit.
words.defineEn: someone who prepares news to be broadcast or writes for newspapers, magazines, or news websites
words.defineVi: người chuẩn bị tin tức để phát sóng hoặc viết cho báo, tạp chí hoặc trang web tin tức

examples: The waiter opened the bottle of wine for the guests.
Our waiter cleared the empty plates from the table.
Throughout the evening, the waiter handled the busy restaurant.
The waiter patiently answered our questions about the ingredients in the dish.
The waiter recommended trying the dressed oysters.
words.defineEn: a man who brings people food and drinks in restaurants, cafes, etc.
words.defineVi: một người đàn ông mang thức ăn và đồ uống cho mọi người trong nhà hàng, quán cà phê, v.v.

examples: Our waitress poured water for everyone at the table.
The waitress took our orders and brought us our drinks.
Andrews' favorite waitress means well when she puts in a good word for him with Tierney.
I asked the waitress for the bill after finishing my meal.
We thanked the waitress for her excellent service before leaving the restaurant.
words.defineEn: a woman who brings people food and drinks in restaurants, cafes, etc.
words.defineVi: một người phụ nữ mang thức ăn và đồ uống cho mọi người trong nhà hàng, quán cà phê, v.v.

words.defineEn: a salesperson; someone whose job is to serve or help customers in a shop
words.defineVi: một nhân viên bán hàng; một người có công việc là để phục vụ hoặc giúp đỡ khách hàng trong một cửa hàng

examples: The receptionist led the way to the boardroom.
The receptionist sat behind the desk, welcoming visitors.
The receptionist informed me that the manager is not available at the moment.
Please collect the documents from the receptionist before leaving the building.
I mean, I'm a receptionist at Soul Cycle.
words.defineEn: a person who greets and deals with people arriving at or calling a hotel, office building, doctor's office, etc.
words.defineVi: một người chào đón và giao dịch với những người đến hoặc gọi đến khách sạn, tòa nhà văn phòng, văn phòng bác sĩ, v.v.

examples: The policeman hammered home the dangers of drinking and driving.
The policeman pinched his eyes as if overcome with a sudden stab of pain.
As soon as he saw the policeman, he ran off like a scalded cat.
The tourist finds a policeman.
Two policemen arrive quickly.
words.defineEn: a man whose job is to protect people, catch criminals, and make sure that laws are obeyed
words.defineVi: một người đàn ông có nhiệm vụ bảo vệ mọi người, truy bắt tội phạm và đảm bảo luật pháp được tuân thủ

examples: Her next role is to play the most highly decorated policewoman in New York City.
"She's at the doctor's," a policewoman says.
Then Mel tells the policewoman her story.
the policewoman asks Mel. 'Are you famous?'

DR. HARLAN KRUMHOLZ, Professor of Medicine, Yale School of Medicine: There are plenty of people in society who are going to work every day, placing themselves at risk, in order to keep society going, in order to deliver packages, to provide groceries, to enable those vital services, policemen and firemen and firewomen and policewomen, all going out and doing their jobs, but placing themselves in positions where they're around others.
words.defineEn: a woman whose job is to protect people, catch criminals, and make sure that laws are obeyed
words.defineVi: một người phụ nữ có nhiệm vụ bảo vệ mọi người, truy bắt tội phạm và đảm bảo luật pháp được tuân thủ

words.defineEn: someone who is employed in a factory and works there
words.defineVi: một người đang làm việc trong một nhà máy và làm việc ở đó

examples: The helicopter transported the injured person to the hospital.
He later died in hospital.
The hospital's plea for donors tugged at the heartstrings of millions of viewers.
While in hospital, Jeremy took stock of his life.
I have to go to hospital for an operation.
words.defineEn: a large building where sick or injured people receive medical treatment and care
words.defineVi: một tòa nhà lớn nơi những người bị bệnh hoặc bị thương được điều trị và chăm sóc y tế

examples: Many shops have raised their prices.
Her father kept a grocer's shop.
The shopkeeper closed the shop for a short break.
He and his fellow workers would incessantly talk shop in the village pub.
The big fellow keeps a fish shop near the post office.
words.defineEn: a building or place that sells goods or services
words.defineVi: một tòa nhà hoặc địa điểm bán hàng hóa hoặc dịch vụ

examples: The restaurant featured a signature dish of slow-roasted brisket.
On the credit side, the restaurant offers a wide range of choices.
The restaurant served their fish and chips with a side of brown sauce.
The restaurant served a mouthwatering plate of spaghetti with bolognese pasta sauce.
The restaurant offered a delightful combination of prosciutto and Parmesan tortelli.
words.defineEn: a place where we pay to sit and eat a meal
words.defineVi: một nơi mà chúng tôi trả tiền để ngồi và ăn một bữa ăn

examples: The new president takes office in January.
This room would make a nice office.
The keys are kept in my office.
The Mayor left office in 2018.
Go to the principal's office, now!
words.defineEn: a building, a room, or a place where people work, particularly behind a desk
words.defineVi: tòa nhà, phòng hoặc nơi mọi người làm việc, đặc biệt là sau bàn làm việc

examples: Cobbled streets run down to a tiny harbor.
The new smartphone is streets ahead of its predecessor, with a larger screen and more powerful processor.
The experienced lawyer is streets ahead of her young colleagues, with a deep understanding of the law and years of courtroom experience.
The street vendor served crispy trotter bites with a tangy dipping sauce at the food market.
The protesters raised their cries for justice and equality in the streets.
words.defineEn: a public path for vehicles in a village, town, or city, usually with buildings, houses, etc. on its sides
words.defineVi: một con đường công cộng dành cho các phương tiện trong một ngôi làng, thị trấn hoặc thành phố, thường có các tòa nhà, nhà ở, v.v. ở hai bên

examples: I couldn't help notice how pretty and intelligent she was and we just clicked.
Other intelligent animals experience grief in similar ways.
Are they intelligent?
What would intelligent life look like?
You're very intelligent.
words.defineEn: having or showing a high level of intelligence; good at learning things, understanding ideas, and thinking clearly
words.defineVi: có hoặc thể hiện mức độ thông minh cao; giỏi học hỏi mọi thứ, hiểu ý tưởng và suy nghĩ rõ ràng

words.defineEn: a man whose job involves mixing and serving drinks, particularly alcoholic drinks, in a bar
words.defineVi: một người đàn ông có công việc liên quan đến pha chế và phục vụ đồ uống, đặc biệt là đồ uống có cồn, trong một quán bar

examples: Yet, for the moment anyway, the bankers have lost their Midas touch.
Lack of oversight allowed overzealous investment bankers to play Old Harry with the economy.
- Bankers suck!
- I love bankers!
Northern bankers financed the purchase of land for plantations.
words.defineEn: a person who has a high rank in a bank or any other financial institution
words.defineVi: một người có thứ hạng cao trong ngân hàng hoặc bất kỳ tổ chức tài chính nào khác

examples: The chef impressed the customers by his special dish of button mushrooms with crumbled feta cheese.
The bakery offered gluten-free options for customers with dietary restrictions.
Customer service calls went unanswered.
Our mascarpone cheesecake is a customer favorite
Customers feel they have been left up the creek without a paddle by the bank.
words.defineEn: a person, organization, company, etc. that pays to get things from businesses or stores
words.defineVi: một người, tổ chức, công ty, v.v. trả tiền để lấy đồ từ doanh nghiệp hoặc cửa hàng

examples: This dish will serve four hungry people.
To do the dishes.
The restaurant offered a vegetarian dish with a mix of seasonal vegetables.
The chef sprinkled a generous amount of roe on the dish.
The restaurant offered a specialty hamburger steak dish.
words.defineEn: a flat, shallow container for cooking food in or serving it from
words.defineVi: một hộp phẳng, nông để nấu thức ăn trong hoặc phục vụ nó từ
